input.description:
String value - The name of a configuration item defined in a configuration module.
Example: OMNIbus, HP_NNM

XML document - The event concept XML containins specific elements used to assign multiple values to a single context item. Each value is associated with an element of the Concept.
Some instances of Input concepts are: adapter name, configuration name, username, password, etc.,. The following sample represents an event mangement concept.
EXAMPLE: <Event xmlns="AutoPilot-OA-Event_Management"> <serial xmlns="" /> <id xmlns="">Interface or Port Failure on 255.255.255.255</id> <node xmlns="">255.255.255.255</node> <node-alias xmlns="" /> <first-occurrence xmlns="" /> <associated-ticket-id xmlns="" /> <alert-group xmlns="">NODE_DOWN</alert-group> <agent xmlns="" /> <alert-key xmlns="">Port/Interface Failure: 255.255.255.255</alert-key> <community xmlns="">public</community> <enterprise-oid xmlns="">1.3.6.1.4.1.11.2.17.1</enterprise-oid> <varbind-param-name xmlns="">1.3.6.1.4.1.11.2.17.2.1.0</varbind-param-name> <varbind-param-value xmlns="">14</varbind-param-value> <varbind-param-type xmlns="">2</varbind-param-type> <category xmlns="">Alert</category> <operation xmlns="" /> <manager xmlns="" /> <acknowledged xmlns="" /> <owner-id xmlns="">4321</owner-id> <owner-group-id xmlns="" /> <escalation-level xmlns="">0</escalation-level> <severity xmlns="">Major</severity> <summary xmlns="">Interface or port failure on device 255.255.255.255</summary> <journal xmlns="" xml:space="preserve" /> </Event>

output.description: XML document containing elements necessary to interact with custom applications.

documentation.description: This workflow will update an event.
